meanings.definition: Agitas (verb): to cause anxiety or agitation
meanings.sent1: The loud noise outside can agitas the dog.
meanings.sent2: She always agitas her friends by telling scary stories.
meanings.sent3: The suspenseful movie really agitas the audience.
meanings.sent4: The constant uncertainty can agitas the mind like a storm.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds looming overhead agitas the entire town.

meanings.definition: Agitas (noun): a state of nervousness or unease
meanings.sent1: His constant fidgeting showed his agitas before the big test.
meanings.sent2: The crowded room filled her with agitas.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected visitor caused a wave of agitas in the household.
meanings.sent4: The looming deadline created a cloud of agitas over the team.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence in the forest brought a sense of agitas to the hikers.
